label: ER E/M Level Inflation
description: ER visit billed at Level 5 without supporting complexity
narrative: Patient presents to the ER with mild chest discomfort. Vitals stable, ECG performed.

label: Trauma Activation Abuse
description: Trauma activation fee billed without trauma criteria
narrative: Minor fall at home; patient brought to trauma center. No major injuries.

label: Observation → Inpatient Inflation
description: Observation stay billed as inpatient admission
narrative: Patient admitted overnight for dehydration. Doctor notes fluids and vitals monitoring.

label: ICU Level Inflation
description: ICU room charges without ICU-level services
narrative: Patient monitored on general ward post-op; no ICU care required.

label: Surgical Unbundling
narrative: Laparoscopic appendectomy performed; surgery, anesthesia, closure documented.

label: Lab Panel Fragmentation
description: Lab panels split into individual tests
narrative: Routine metabolic panel ordered; lab reports sodium, potassium, creatinine, glucose.

label: Radiology Component Fragmentation
narrative: Abdominal CT with contrast; radiologist performs reading and tech work.

label: ER Charge Stacking
description: Routine ER services billed à la carte
narrative: Minor laceration treated in ER; basic exam and dressing.

label: Modifier -25 Abuse
description: E/M billed with minor procedure using -25
narrative: Routine office visit plus minor wart removal.

label: Modifier -59 Abuse
description: Modifier used to bypass bundling edits
narrative: Multiple injections during same visit.

label: Anesthesia Time Padding
narrative: Knee arthroscopy with general anesthesia.

label: Observation Hour Inflation
narrative: Overnight observation for mild asthma exacerbation.

label: OR / PACU Time Overstatement
narrative: Knee arthroscopy; surgery 45 min, PACU 30 min.

label: Drug Unit Overbilling
narrative: IV antibiotic given 2 doses.

label: Supply Quantity Inflation
narrative: Patient receives 3 wound dressings.

label: Duplicate CPT Billing
description: Same CPT billed twice same date
narrative: Single radiograph performed once.

label: Ghost (Phantom) Services
narrative: Physical therapy consult ordered but not performed.

label: Late-Posted Charges
narrative: Patient discharged; later lab results posted.

label: Assistant Surgeon Abuse
narrative: Appendectomy with surgical assistant present.

label: Anesthesia Direction Abuse
narrative: Anesthesia supervised by anesthesiologist but performed by resident.

label: Outpatient Facility Fee Abuse
description: Facility fee added to clinic visit
narrative: Routine outpatient clinic visit.

label: Place-of-Service Inflation
description: Hospital POS used for routine care
narrative: Telehealth follow-up incorrectly coded as in-clinic.

label: J-Code Markup Abuse
description: Injectable drugs billed far above cost
narrative: IV chemotherapy administered.

label: Oral Med Inpatient Pricing
description: Common oral meds billed at IP rates
narrative: Inpatient oral antibiotics.

label: No Self-Pay Discount
narrative: Patient paying cash.

label: Cash-Pay Rate Inversion
narrative: Self-pay patient; negotiated insurance rate lower.

label: No Surprises Act Violation
description: OON ancillary billing in protected care
narrative: Out-of-network imaging in emergency.

label: GFE Overrun
narrative: Patient received GFE $500 for knee MRI; actual $900.

label: Revenue Code Misclassification
narrative: Infusion administered in outpatient clinic.

label: Preventive → Diagnostic Misbilling
narrative: Annual wellness visit performed; preventive documented.

label: Length-of-Stay Padding
narrative: Patient admitted 2 nights for mild pneumonia.

label: Supply Kit Double Billing
narrative: Wound kit used for dressing change.

label: Tech / Prof Duplicate Imaging
narrative: X-ray read by radiologist; technical component billed twice.

label: Max Observation Edge Case
narrative: Patient observed 23 hours for mild dehydration.

label: Disposable Device Markup
description: Single-use device billed at extreme rate
narrative: Single-use orthopedic device administered.
